review: Food is not very good. Hamburger cooked medium when I asked for well done and onions put on when asked for no onions. To boot, it was not very tasty. However, they did take the burger off the bill and the manager apologized for the mix-up.

Meh.  I thought the burger, for it's price point, should have had a lot more flavor. I'll give them respect for the bottomless fries, but I wasn't overwhelmed with the hamburger.  Add to that the location of this place can make it very difficult to reach at times, and you get an experience that I don't intend to repeat soon.

Dinner date. I ate the bacon cheeseburger & my other half ate bbq burger. Both were delicious. We asked for more fries. Brought us a basket of maybe six fries. Our server Arnold was not attentive & gave us our check before we had asked. I still was ordering drinks. The restaurant wasn't busy so no excuses for bad service. I felt like I was being rushed to leave. I will go back just don't want same server.
Bottomless fries and delicious burgers. Kind of pricy.
Our most recent visit returned to the service and quality we expect from Red Robin. Burgers cooked properly, sides well done, service attentive and pleasant.  I'm glad things improved this time.

Was very disappointed with this place.i ordered the double cheese burger and when it came out it looked like a jr burger.not to mention the bun was burnt and the burger it's self just not very good. I've heard a lot of hype about this place and I'm scratching my head on why?this was my first visit to this place and prob will be my last.kind of pricy too. Should have gone down the street to bottle caps.their burgers are way better then this place.

We do enjoy ourselves some red robin on the nights we feel like we can take advantage of their bottomless fries. I usually order my giant salad and eat off of the hubbies fries. The last few times there have been more goof ups but they are usually resolved pretty quickly. (We are pretty easy going.) We would stop by here more often but William D Tate was a pain before construction, last time we came here it was almost impossible to leave the restaurant! Hopefully that works it's self out and the businesses in this area don't suffer too much for it.

Look. I like Red Robin's burgers, I do. As a vegetarian, you can throw a Garden Burger on to almost any of their burgers and have a fantastic meal. I particularly love the chicken bruschetta burger, minus the chicken. The thing is their prices. Their prices, and the set up of their bar area. I have said it before - I love children, I work with children every day, but I do not want to hang out with kids in my free time. So why, why dear sweet lord in heaven above, would they put the children's arcade area adjacent to the bar?? And an even bigger why is why do people seat their families in the bar area??? IT'S A BAR. You cannot escape children in this restaurant. Nothing ruins a beer and a burger for me like children screaming for quarters to play arcade games or for the attention of their parents who are clearly trying to pretend like their children are strange savages, unknown to them, while they try to get a buzz on. Their prices do them no favors - we recently went to redeem my free birthday burger (hooray!) but even with us only paying for one burger and two beers, the tab was about $10 more than it would have been for us to both get a burger, get two gigantic beers each, and maybe even a side of fries and tater tots at our favorite mom & pop burger joint right down the road. So even with free shit (and like any normal person, I LOVE free shit) they still aren't winning my favor. Maybe it's worth it if you just really want one of their gigantic milkshakes?

This is  me & my husband 's mid week go to place. I know it's a burger resturant but a lot of people don't know about their "wings". The  wings are unbelievably good. They put the neighboring wing joints: Buffalo, Plukers & Hooters to shame. Along with the bottomless fries?,Man!!!. Say what you will about the burgers but the wings are really big & meaty. A basket of about eight to ten for five bucks all day long you can not beat.  The girls working the bar at nite, Victoria, Britney and the other one with the awesome colored hair, are phenomenal. They mix a pretty good drink to help get over the hump. I think it's a nice touch that the  manager, Jerry is always visibly notice, stopping by each  table with a  pleasant smile making sure the guest are doing okay.  I do think that they should get rid of the video games area or move it away from the bar. I just dont see the point in this day & age of kids paying to play some chuckie cheese video arcade when they no doudt have a more safisicated game system waiting for them at home. I wish my son would ask me for a dollar in quarters to play a game when I just paid $300 plus for a brand new game system, please. Anyway, that a different subject.   I really can't find any major fault  about this place. All I can say about the location is that they were on W.D. Tate before all the mess of  construction started.  It's a great spot. As long as they keep the wings big, flavorable & the price reasonable, you'll find me and the hubby there mid week when the desire to cook at home is zero.

I will try to be brief. I have managed 5 star restaurants and a casino for the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Chain so my standards are very HIGH for customer service, food and cleanliness. There should be NO mistake or half stepping with these three TOP PRIORITIES in any class of food chain. Profits flow when this is in order and supervised. This burger joint looks like its owners and management took a long vacation and lost their way back home. I personally walked the restaurant while eating there and asked 2 tables how was their service. 1 (one) table said the waitress will be mad when she sees her "To Insure Proper Service" as nothing $0.00, because this establishment hurries to take your order; hurries you to eat. My waitress picked up the check and cash then said "would you like change back".  Which is TOTALLY unacceptable she literally asked for her "TIPS". Wait staff just take the check and charge and return the rest the customer decides NOT the wait staff. Bathroom was filthy, carpet was stained and dirty and when we sat down the booths had food in the chair still. Whom ever doesn't't look or complaint about these situation deserve to eat here. I will continue to eat in 4 to 5 star establishments you get what you pay for.  P.S I forgot the managers clothing looked like he took his cloths out of his hamper before he arrived to work. Totally unacceptable.
Good, solid burger.  Good choices, consistency across the chain.  Fish sandwitch cannot be beat - and lets not forget the endless french fries!!!

Went to this RR Thurs Aug 1st. Spinach artichoke dip ok, burgers great, fries super excellent cooked extra crispy ever so hot! Burning our fingers and mouths but oh so good. Our son had cheesecake; we tasted, he loved it we liked it. What makes it a 5 star for us was the service. Our waiter was Jacob and he was attentive, friendly, and eager to go out of his way to make our experience the best it could be. What a joy that young man was.
Great burger, great fries and excellent service!!!  They also had a special on margaritas for $3 and they were great as well!!  Will definitely come back!!

I went in with my clients and we waited almost 5 mins to even get seated - mind you that there was no one up front so people were just waiting. No problem understand it's lunch hour and it can get busy. Soon as we sat down the server promptly took our drink order - which came out fast.  This was first time visiting this location and they have wide varieties of selections and we asked to give us a moment; that moment was about 15mins - he said he had a birthday party table.  We understand but it would of been nice to check in while getting their drink or just inform us that'll he'll come back. It took almost 45mins before we got our fries then the burgers came out (they have bottomless french fries) Food was good but service could improve.

My first time at a red robin. Got excited since there was so much "zagat this zagat that" on the menu.  Hummus was poor with stale chips, kind of like mines at home. The giant onion rings were wonderfully crunchy. Bottomless fries were OK... not good enough to get a second round.  My pineapple burger was good, but way too saucy? Flavory? Messy? Took too much away from the burger itself. Only able to finish half before I threw in the towel. However, I was impressed by the way the burger still held its shape as leftovers the next day... you'd think it be soggy but they use superbuns.

Not going to write a long review on this one. Food was great.. bottomless steak fries. And it came out in a timely manner, I didn't however like having to ask for refills every time. And well, we only got our refills twice. Once the waitress got paid out (mid meal, might I add) she stopped coming around. The manager did well to check on us every so often though. That was the only disappointment. Service wasn't that great.. and she left all the empty glasses at our table when she brought new ones.

Amazing burgers with a huge selection.  My wife and 2 kids (4 years old and 1 year old) went here because I wanted to try the new Grapevine Craft Brewery beer. They had it plus a ton of other great craft beers including Revolver's Blood and Honey. We ordered our food and it was there before the kids even had time to become super annoying. I had the ragin cajun which is awesome. They've redone their plates and serving and it feels a lot more gourmet. They still have wonderful bottomless fries too.  So we had the Lakefire beer (the grapevine craft brewery beer) and it was awesome. The manager came over to check on us and to say thanks. When I told him why we were there he offered another beer of my choosing for free. Totally cool. We'll for sure be back at this Red Robin.

I'm not sure why but I always feel disappointed because I never make it to a refill of fries.  Now with their expanded beer menu makes it even harder not to leave here stuffed.  It's always pretty basic I'm never disappointed but there are many other places where you can grab a better burger.  Dinner here with my wife always makes for a cheap date however!

Have been here many, many times over the years with many different people and not one person has EVER been dissatisfied!  Love this restaurant! PLUS, if you become a member of the online Royal Rewards club, you receive a FREE burger on your birthday.  Enjoyed mine today!!

Meh. First time here and probably the last. Visit started out strong and we were optimistic when we got the yummy onion rings for an app. We weren't drinking beer on this visit, but I certainly would have ordered a Lakefire beer (being a local beer and all), if our intrusive and always-bugging-us waiter had mentioned it. Instead, he was just trying to get our order in before we even sat down. Anyway, very good onion rings and the fries that came with the sandwich and burger were pretty tasty too. The BLTA sandwich was sad. Since bacon was the first ingredient in the name, I kinda thought it would come with more than a one square inch piece on each half. About the same amount of avocado too. Basically, it was an expensive turkey sandwich with nothing but pressed turkey and a ton of lettuce. He got the burger with an egg thing. Unfortunately, as soon as he picked it up, the whole bun disintegrated before he could even get a bite. Messy food is usually good, but this was just a pile of stuff that wasn't really worth the trouble. Throw that all together with the waiter that was always there but didn't accomplish much, and we were ready to get out of there.  May stop back in for some fries and local beer someday, but there's really going to have to be no other options available.

Service here is great :) burgers are good. Never been here but I would recommend this place.  Prices are reasonable well it's kind of high for burgers but they make up for it with bottomless fries.  I love the seasoning on the table.
Nice go to place, burgers are good, frys are bottomless and the beer's cold. What else do u need? Did I mention the people are nice too?
Love the burgers here!  Probably had some of the best meat to cheese combination burgers here I have ever had.  Try the never ending root beer float.
Visiting Great Wolf and stopped by here for dinner. Only had to wait about 5 minutes. Service was great and food was great.

Came in to eat for lunch with the gf. We were greated and seated quickly . not busy at all a few tables in the entire restaurant. We had a server named Jeff. He was rude right off the back maybe cause we are young and he thinks we don't tip? Well not the case. I'm a server / bartender and my gf is as well. We still tip 20% even though he was rude with lack of words and the experience he gave us was we were unwanted. Other than that the food was great. We both got burgers. The bbq sauce they have is amazing. Its very tasty with the fries. If you order a soda u may want to order a water with it so u have something to drink while u wait for your refill. If u order water order a second one cause the refill time is pretty long. Any ways we will go back but specifically request NOT to sit in jeffs section.
Went here while on vacation for dinner with family. The service was excellent, waiter checked back often. The atmosphere was nice, not too crowded. Food was average, menu was large.

Where have you been all my life!  Well well well, we need one of these around my parts.  The burgers....very scrumptious may I add.   I'm a steak fries kinda guy and boy does this chain/place delivers.  Great Service.  If visiting, will come back to check it out. Grade: B

Before coming here, thought this place was another Fuddruckers but that is so far from the truth, red Robin has so much more the service and their menus makes Fuddruckers look like a sonic... Really enjoyed the specialty burgers and the root beer floats are good as well. The Decour was very unique the staff were friendly and very helpful to newcomers that really did not know the menu. The waitress took time out asking questions and given us her opinion on the burgers and side items which she thought was best. Also the Bar has it all, the mixologist really knows her stuff. Was a very pleasant experience and will be returning as soon as possible.

Was ok. I don't know. Gourmet burgers in the shape of a pre made patty.  Don't get me wrong. I like Red Robin. If you say gourmet. Do gourmet and not a patty. Get a lump of  meat and hand make it in the grill. Show us real gourmet please.

I know, I know, it's a chain.  BUT, that A-1 peppercorn burger, when cooked right, is my favorite.  I usually ask for more peppercorn sauce (they can be stingy) with it.  I also love their fries, especially dipped in campfire sauce.  Mmmmm, time for my free birthday burger.  Staff is hit or miss here, but a lot of times we are helped by a learning high schooler.

The service wasn't very professional, more "What do you want?" than "What can I get for you?" My banzai burger was greasy and didn't have much teriyaki sauce on it. They were also out of a lot of the beers on their menu, or their machine wasn't working or something. Received incorrect change back too. With all the restaurants in the Grapevine area I don't think I'll be returning to Red Robin.

My brother in law worked for this company for years and it had always been a family favorite. Last night however was quite possibly the worst food I had ever had. No take into consideration I had a table top of twelve people. We all ordered burgers, alcohol beverages and starters. It took us about fifteen minutes to get our drinks, and then about twenty to get the appetizers; which were very lack luster in taste. My burger had to be returned twice, a simple cheese burger with lettus, and pickles couldn't be made then my husbands burger came out rare when he asked for medium. All in all, worst money spent.

Red Robin has always been one of my favorite places for burgers. I wouldn't exactly give it 4 stars, maybe 3.7 if that were possible.  My Crispy Chicken Sandwich was very delicious. Almost didn't Finnish because it was huge. The endless steak fries were nice too, but I couldn't imagine ordering more fries with how stuffed I was. I ordered a side of cole slaw as well, it was alittle dry, maybe next time I'll pass on it. Service was great. Will return.

Red Robin is really 3.5 Stars. They offer such a variety of food and their Burgers are pretty darn tasty. Service was always fair, but the restaurant seemed a little run-down and at times quite dirty. I've not been in awhile, but family trekked out last night and had a very good time here. The joint was hopping and the hostess' were very friendly and helpful. Brittany waited on us and did an outstanding job. Food was delivered quick and fresh and the restaurant, at least from the bar area, seemed very clean.  It was a good time by all and we definitely will be back. Great job!
What's not to love about this place?  The atmosphere is nice, service was excellent and the Burgers were to die for!  Will definitely be back!

We came to this Red Robin location late on a weekend night  because we had been out and about and were pushing the envelope to grab some dinner.  It is kind funny that we came to a bugger spot, because none of us actually ordered a burger. We were greeted at the door and seated right away at a booth.  Our waitress came by right away and took our drink order.  When she came back with our drinks we went ahead and got our food order as we were all ready to eat. I like to get the fried clam strips here.  There are not a lot places that you can get fried clam strips so this is always something special I get here.  The clams are always tender, and are a good size.  The portion is generous, and combined the fires it makes a full meal. The family really enjoys the chicken fingers and fries, and we got a tower of onion rings.  The rings were very good, the crust was flaky and crunchy, and they were served piping hot. The manager stopped by to check on the service, and overall we had a great experience.  Overall we enjoyed our visit.
The service was fine, but the food was subpar. I believe dfw has much better burger joints. The water here tastes really bad, which is a bit concerning...
We drive an hour from North Texas it's worth the drive For the bacon cheese burger and fries I wish y'all would open one in Frisco Texas Were ready for ya!!

I went for lunch today because they participate in the Hilton Honors Dining Dollars rewards program. I have been to other Red Robin Burger joints before and they are always tasty and clean. This one is no exception. I had the California Grilled Chicken sandwich and it was awesome. I didn't have to wait long and it was fresh and hot when it arrived. The fries were good too. I love that seasoned salt they have here. The burgers are also noteworthy and should be eaten (in moderation of course). I have not had a burger from this location, but at the Red Robins in NC and FL, they are really damn good. I was on my lunch break, so I had a Diet Coke to drink, but I always make mental observations about what is available on tap in case I decide to come back for happy hour or before I recommend having drinks to my coworkers or friends. This one had a few decent ones, but not my favorite. That loses it one star. The staff was friendly. The prices were average to moderately high compared to the competition of the same caliber. The chicken sandwich, Diet Coke and 20% tip (which I leave for everyone wherever I go unless the service is exceptionally bad) came out to be about 18 bucks. The average tab for the same lunch at Twin Peaks, Buffalo Wild Wing and Hooters is usually around $14, so this one is just a bit higher (BWW is closer at $16). Overall it is a perfect place for lunch. I enjoyed the food. I was in and out. They have free wireless internet that works and isn't painfully slow (like it is at Hooters). Give them a shot and see what you think. I have a feeling that you will be impressed.

3 stars for consistency.  I will say, however, that the service and our appetizer failed on our last visit.  Our server was far from personality plus but he was not rude or off putting, just kind of like a wet rag.  Our pretzel appetizer was kind of gross - it tasted fried.  We were expecting something not so greasy.  Our entrees were good, consistent with our former visits.  Beer prices are excellent here.

I love red robin. That is a simple fact. This red robin had awesome food, but terrible service. We went to eat at 5pm and it was dead. The waiter took 10 minutes to just get our drink order and never even brought me a water until 4 minutes before I left.  He didn't even bring me a refill of fries, and checked on us only once when only a minute after he initially brought our food. Probably will not come back to this location for the service.

The service was good as was the food.   We were greeted and seated right away.  Our server Tony was great!  He was attentive and listened to options we were considering.  The food was hot and fresh.  We would visit again.

This location use to be really good. We went Sunday about 3:30 had 2 small children with us ask for a table. They sat us in the Bar area on the very high seats. The dining area had 2 tables of about 40 occupied. One child 3 fell out of one of the high chairs no serious injury but a lot of yelling. Ordered clam chowder and burgers got the chowder after about 30 minutes fresh from the microwave potatoes were raw with no garlic bread, ask for the bread the waitress said it was in the oven where it apparently stayed, we never saw any, same thing happened about 2 months ago when we went there with the soup so don't order that. Order mac a cheese for the kids the 5 year old ate most of it the 3 year was still nursing her wounds. The burgers arrived about 1 hour and fifteen minutes after ordering and were not of the same quality as they use to be in the years past but twice the price, the dining area now had one table occupied one family left.  Not worth the 45 dollars they took from us plus tip.  My wife makes me tip even if the service doesn't warrant it.

As always the wait staff and burgers were great . But I am writing this review to tell people the must try their fresh hot doughnut dessert. This is a great dessert to spilt with a friend to add a little sweetness on top of a very savory meal.  It was like little round pieces of haven with a hole and lightly sugared!!

Came in about 3:30 on a Saturday. This place is huge compared to others I've been to and can accommodate big groups easily. Looks like a couple little league teams were in here. Service was ok, I would think they would be a little faster since it was middle of the day.  On to the food. We had the royal, egg, bacon cheese, tomato, lettuce, mayo, I got mine plane though. It was pretty good, can't say anything bad about it. It comes w bottomless steak fries, this will run you at about $11. Also got an Oreo shake which was delicious, runs about $3.50. Good solid place to go, nothing spectacular and wouldn't be opposed to going here again. But for $11 you could go to jakes or hopdoddys.

It is just another chain to me unfortunately. I am not a huge fan of the big thick fries. Give me matchstick thin crispy ones any day! I think they do have sweet potato ones though and would go back next time maybe just to try those. They put my cider in a festive Angry Orchard glass so I did love that. The burgers are ok. They do have gluten free buns (or no bun option)  as well as veggie burgers so that is a nice alternative. It's a good place to bring family and I hear you get a free burger on your birthday. But aside from all that I'm just not incredibly impressed and feel like there are so many other burger joints in the area. Service was good and the people were so nice and friendly. Star added back just for that.

When me and my family went to red robins, we were seated quickly and had an instant waiter. We got our appetizers, onion rings with sauces such as ranch. The onion rings were terrific. When me and my family ordered the food came in around 15 minutes later, it was delicious! The food and service was great! Plan to come here again!

The lunch special is good and the food is cheap. However almost every time I come here the service is terrible. None of the waiters or waitresses seem like they want to be there. Customer service is definitely not their forte.

I've only eaten at Red Robin once before, probably about 5 years ago and it happened to be at this particular location. I've since had to go gluten-free and was happy to hear that they serve a gluten-free bun. I hadn't had a hamburger in a while and figured this would be the time to have one. We went on a Tuesday during the 12 - 1 lunch time and the place wasn't overly crowded. We were seated immediately and it didn't take long for the server to come over and take our drink orders. He was pleasant, but not what I'd call friendly and seemed to be in a hurry to move on. I got a feeling that he was rushing us along. Although the music was so loud it was difficult to hear what he was saying. He asked if we wanted fries while we waited for our orders. He brought the fries, took the orders and left before we could ask for napkins and silverware. I'm not really sure why they advertise their burgers as "gourmet" other than they can then charge over $10 for a hamburger and fries. There was nothing special or gourmet about my guacamole and bacon burger. It wasn't thick by any means. The bacon was more like little pieces of bacon with a thin smear of guacamole. It was more lettuce than anything else. The gluten-free bun was like hard rubber. I tried to cut the sandwich in half but it was so tough and my steak knife met with so much resistance that the knife literally flipped out of my hand and landed on the floor. The server never once came back to ask how our food was or to ask if we wanted more of their "endless fries". On the whole I'd say the meal was not worth the money. Paying just under eleven bucks for a burger and a handful of fries is a little pricey in my opinion. I doubt I'll be back to Red Robin anytime soon.

I was well pleased with my first experience at Red Robin. The hostess was friendly and asked it was our first time here. She thanked me for choosing Red Robin. Our waitress was very friendly and outgoing. She charmed our kids and had them both laughing and talking with her. The food was great. My burger was perfect as was the hubby's. Kids had chicken strips and pizza with no complaints. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. Makes me wish I had a Red Robin near where I live!

Seated right away at 5:10 on Sunday afternoon. Hostess wanted to stick me in the bar because I was  alone (I'm guessing). Asked and received a small booth in back of restaurant. Is warm and stuffy back here, even waitress remarked on it. Have been looking at the filthy un-bussed table diagonal from me throughout my meal. Apparently cleaning up isn't a high priority, even though it's not busy yet. Ordered their Jungle Shake to start - skip this. Supposed to be Baileys Irish Cream blended with banana liqueur, chocolate syrup and vanilla ice cream. Is nothing but a chocolate shake. No hint of  spirits at all. No banana or Baileys detected. Bonus: it was a mess! Like every shake I've ever had here, it was served dripping over the sides and already melting. Yes, it's 100 degrees outside and it's warm in my section, but this is Red Robin Grapevine modus operandi. They can't bother themselves to wipe it down before serving. Huge mess. Got the plain old Gourmet cheeseburger, medium, with pepper jack and no onions. Automatically comes with lettuce, tomato, pickle, mayo and bottomless steak fries. Ordered a wheat bun. Nothing special here. Greasy, dripping onto plate (which is plastic). Fries are good, so that was a relief. Also ordered the huge mud slide dessert. Ice cream and Oreo cookie crumbles drizzled with chocolate and caramel sauces. Ate the entire thing and not going to apologize. Wasn't top notch ice cream for sure (prefer gelato) but it was a great sugar bomb and eased my crankiness with the rest of the meal. Nice waitress, decent service. But now I remember why I never eat here when I'm craving a burger. Total before tax/tip was $25.19.

Had lunch here with the family.  Called ahead to let them know I was in transit and was quickly seated.  The table we were gonna sit at was directly under a skylight window, so I asked to be moved and was quickly accomodated. Angry manager kept coming to the area and surveying/glaring (made me feel like I was being supervised eating)  Apparently there was a large party coming In and she didn't want anyone seated there (another party was seated after us at the next table..so I was able to overhear her scold them for seating people there) food and service were reasonable, nothing stands out though...with so many options here, it's  just okay
Service sucks, we got our food after everybody who sat down after us, plates were greasy dirty, and food was thrown together like they could care less.

Love this place!! I've grown to like burgers, and Red Robin has one of the best burgers around. I like the Red Robin, Banzai, and their varieties of wraps. I enjoy their healthy options as well for the days that I'm feeling guilty about what I'm eating. I had the Chophouse Burger this time, and it was so filling! Especially with bottomless fries. Aaaaah, so freaking good! Rick was our server today, and he was amazing!! He was quick, observant on what we needed, dealt with all of our complications, and still had a smile on his face the whole time. He's definitely a big part of my 5-star rating. Come here if you're looking for a great, affordable burger!!

Came and ate here for the first time yesterday and instead of my usual reviews, I am just gonna list the pros and cons  Pros:burning love burger, bottomless fries             delicious, it had crisply fried jalapeños , salsa and spicy pepper-jack cheese layered on top of cayenne seasoning. Cooked perfectly and very flavorful. The fries were good, crispy on the outside and fully cooked on the inside. I  added the seasoning to bring out more flavor.  5 stars  Pro: Our server Rick         Really nice guy, got our drinks and took our order in a matter of minutes. They were busy too so he had a lot of tables but he still did his best catering to us.  5 stars   Con: the avo cabbo salad             For a salad that costs over $10 I don't think it was worth it. Some of the lettuce pieces I had were very soggy and old. Didn't come with a lot of avocados, bacon and eggs and the grilled chicken it came with lacked flavor.  2 star   Over all I do really like this place, I will definitely come back for the burger but not getting their salads .
Great customer service, they go far & beyond expectations. Ask for Will the bartender & Beki the manager. They treat you like family!

I have been to this Red Robin several times, always had a great experience...till today. My husband and I went to Red Robin for dinner, got there about 5:30pm. Seated quickly, as very few people were there.  The host was super nice, however, the waitress, Sam, was far from great. My husband and I were the only ones in her section, except for a couple that were leaving. We ordered drinks and our food quickly, we got both within 10 minutes. I ordered the Red Robin Royal (delish!!!) my husband ordered their new burger on a pretzel bun, and we both had endless fries. Our drinks were only refilled once, I had to stop Sam and ask for refills, AFTER I saw her pass our table and notice both our empty glasses. The second time, she came by our table...I had half my burger gone and we both had no fries. She didn't ask if we wanted refills on drinks, she didn't ask if we wanted more fries...she did, however, ask if I wanted a to go box! Ummmm...we had only been there about 20 minutes, I was only half way done and neither of us had refills on anything. I was not happy!! I said "no, we would like refills on our drinks and more fries" ... She then starts to fill up in her section .. 3 more couple came in. Instead of getting our drinks and putting in our fry order, she goes to two other tables...talks to them for a bit (they had already ordered and gotten appetizers) .. She then brings over the couple across from us more drinks...still not filling ours!! I looked at her, she looks at our empty glasses at the end of the table, then goes and brings us more drinks. Before our 1st refill of fries returns...she hands us the ticket and says "no hurry" .. I said "Sam" ... She doesn't acknowledge me...just goes to the table across from us..then comes back to our table and asked if we needed something...I didn't even realize she heard me. I was actually get to order dessert for my husband and myself since his birthday is tomorrow. However, since I thought she didn't hear me and we were both a bit shocked by the early check...without asking if we wanted anything more...we decided to just pay and leave.  I was extremely disappointed in the service I received. After I put my card in the folder for her to take...she picks it us as she is turning to speak to the table across from us...still not acknowledging us.   I would have said something to the manager, however, my husband asked that I just write a review. If we go back..I will definitely ask for a different waitress than Sam

Staff and food are always on point lov this place been coming here for years and never disappointed. It's funny how we always get the same table just by chance lol. You will always get a manager checking in on your table and the waiters are always kind.

Came to this location for a burger after spending the night in a hotel after a late flight.  This location does not have the table screens that have games or enable a smoother check-out. Also- I asked for the tablet to order my food so I could see the food allergens, but although they had one to give me, no one knew how to get to that screen. Luckily my husband realized he could bring it up on his phone, so I just looked at that. I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Burger. It didn't seem as simple as ordering in other locations (I had to ask them not to season my fries, whereas in other places, the server would bring that up), although I was assured my food allergy would be handled safely.  When my burger was brought out it was missing the special relish that makes the burger "gourmet". A side of it was brought out.  The restaurant was clean and everyone working polite and happy. I did feel like one of the first people to enter with food restrictions though, and that isn't comfortable.

My family and I chose Red Robin for dinner because it was Spirit Night at my daughter's school. We've never eaten there before but what a great experience! I love that they have a great variety on the kids menu, as well as bottomless sides and drinks. The regular was also good and the sweet potato fries were amazing. Most sweet potato fries are limp and soggy but these were crisp and flavorful. Finally, our server was awesome. She was helpful and attentive without being annoying and super sweet to my kids. We'll definitely be back!
Big burgers in almost any configuration you could ask for with the endless fries. Gourmet burgers to meet all your tastes. Can't go wrong with the Robin!

Draft beer smelled musty so they don't maintain their draft system, ordered premium burger $14 McDonald's tastes better. Waitress didn't seem to care if we liked food or not. Will not be going back. In addition place needs a serious update. New paint new bathrooms everything. First and last time. There are much better average places to get an overpriced burger and smelly beer
The service was nice but Loved that Bonzi Burger with an extra pineapple. Our server was very nice and the Rookie Magic hit the spot. Try the sweet potatoe fries with the sauce

Great experience! We were seated promptly and Stefani was an amazing server. She made sure we we had everything we needed and the food was delicious. The $3.00 wedge is massive and so good. If you get a burger, you MUST get an egg on it! And if you get an alcoholic beverage, they are strong! Service was quick and efficient. Recommend Red Robin!

Very disappointing.   The table was dirty and then the silverware was dirty. Horrible service. A manager that really didn't care. Cold french fries. My chicken sandwich was delicious. Only good thing in the visit.

Above Average. After two years in the Metroplex, we made our first trip to Red Robin. We once thought Red Robin burgers were among the best, but after discovering so many great burgers around DFW, they've fallen far down the list. Still, the burgers are good, the fries are endless (although not great) and the atmosphere is good. We liked everything we had, but it's still far from a top choice when we're craving burgers.

Food was great! But the service got kinda salty at the end... the waitress was serving me and my friends, a group of 8, and my friend needed change and the waitress rushed to ask for a tip... she was going to but as a fellow server, this type of thing is unnacceptable. She came back to the table and stated "was my service not good enough for you guys?" In a very condescending way.

I've always heard of this place for their bottomless fries and drinks and we finally gave it a try! I was very surprised to find how big their selection of burgers are. We got a burger and a chicken burger, one with sweet potato fries and one with their steak cut fries. Also got a blue moon shake (not bottomless lol) to try. MMM! For a chain place, we enjoyed ourselves very much here. The burger was a good size, moist and flavorful. Although it wasn't cooked medium rare like the fancier burger places, it was good anyways. It had a reasonable amount of toppings, cant recall what type of burger exactly we got. The chicken burger was good as well, I got the one with grilled chicken and the chicken was grilled perfectly. The fries were good as well! They were kinda addicting, thank goodness they were bottomless! They were seasoned lightly but we had the option of adding our own seasoning ourselves. Overall, yes this place is a chain so don't compare it to places like Hopdoddy, but I would compare this to Fuddruckers and I actually prefer this place! I love the options, and the reasonable price.

Usually good food at most of locations. Seated at Grapevine tonight, carpets are gross, tables and seats have food left all over.  If the dining area is that bad, think about the kitchen. Pretty gross... We just left.
Come and try it every time we come it's great the kids have a blast and the food is great come in and try it out for your self. Plus try the beer selection it's amazing

I have been to Red Robin multiple times in various locations from Virginia to Idaho and had never had a bad experience, so since I'd never been in Texas and it had been a while we decided to this location for a late lunch at around 2 pm on a Friday. We ordered BBQ boneless wings, chili, 2 different burgers with different fries, with multiple sauces. Every last bit was disappointing, as was the service. I am not overwhelmingly nit-picky, but I'm going to give you my full laundry list of issues with my meal, including those which I might not have bothered mentioning had the overall experience been acceptable. The good: -The place seemed clean, the hostess was pleasant, and we were seated promptly. -One of the burgers was okay. The bad and ugly: The boneless wings were almost un-sauced. Half of each wing was completely dry, and the other half was only lightly sauced. I would have asked for sauce but by the time our waitress was back to see how things were or take any further order from us, they would have been cold, and cold boneless wings are worse than un-sauced boneless wings. The ranch was okay, but I'm pretty sure it's a Hidden Valley seasoning packet. I'm not picky, I don't expect scratch ranch at a restaurant in this price range, and I love Hidden Valley. This order of wings itself would not have been a problem had the rest of the meal been acceptable. A bowl of chili was ordered so that we might try it and allow it to influence our burger order (whether or not to order the chili burger). The chilli was completely flavorless and the texture was pretty awful. Not even a quarter of this very small bowl of chilli was eaten. My burger was ordered medium rare with no lettuce or tomato, with extra sauce on the side (after the wings, I'm sure you can see why) with sweet potato fries. The burger was unevenly cooked. It seemed as though it was cooked to done on one side, then flipped and very rare on the other as though they were attempting to make up for the mishap. I could ALMOST understand if they were busy, but again, this is after 2, almost 3 PM on a weekday at this point. In addition to being slightly burnt, which by itself I wouldn't complain about, the sweet potato fries were old and dried to the point at which they did not even look appetizing. Now, I love sweet potato fries and am pretty forgiving of these, but I ate maybe 2. They were terrible. The other burger we had ordered, I had a bite of, and it was actually cooked acceptably. The menu said nothing about lettuce or tomato, but the burger came with it. Whether this was a misprint or a mishap by the cook, there is no telling, but either way it was easily fixable so no real complaint there. The only real problem with this burger, and actually both burgers, is that it was not hot. It was slightly above room temperature, and it seemed as though the plates had been sitting a while before they were brought to our table. This, again, if busy, I could understand, but it is around 3 PM on a weekday. The waitress was just not good. She way too obviously fake. She obviously did not care about anything regarding the table and was only putting on a smile for the sake of her tip. At no point did she attempt any type of rapport or to be a real person, which is fine, as this is just her job I understand this. The issue is though, that as an employee she's paid to put forth effort into my experience as a customer, and as a customer, I am unable to walk into the kitchen to get my food when it's ready. This in itself is not enough to warrant a rant, but there were very few attempts to check with the table, and only after asking for a refill did a glass with only ice that had been sitting empty as she walked by on multiple occasions get refilled with Dr Pepper. As we left the building neither the hostess or employee who appeared to be a manager standing near the door said anything as we walked past. We had not been rude or even complained about our service or food regardless of our issues, and this final display of indifference was the cherry on top of an overall horrendous experience. TL;DR- Indifferent staff leads to unpleasant experience.

Went there for lunch.  Sat there for 5 minutes being passed up by waitresses.   I stopped the manager and one magically popped up.  I placed my order and the other manager, brung me out my food less than 5 minutes later.  It was the nastiness looking burger ever.  Worst then any fast food place.  Idk if it was because I was black... Being that I was the only one in there.  Very poor quality of food and service from this Red Robin!  The other manager took care of the food I didn't eat.  I'll never go back to that one.

Went here for Mother's day, my mom's choice. Chicken tenders were ok, but not great. French fries were nothing spectacular. The Strawberry Lemonade sucked, worse I have ever had! My mom enjoyed the taste of her burger except that the MSG content was high causing her to cough. This was the first time she tried fried pickles and loved them. I won't be eating there again, but she might enjoy it.

Being from California I love me some Red Robin so when I find one I get excited.  They are a little harder to find in Texas but when you do find one the locations are pretty consistent.  This location is a few miles from my job so I can't go a lot but when I do I always have a great experience.  The customer service here is Awesome, starting from the hostesses, waiter/waitress and managers.  Everyone is always very pleasant and attentive.  My burger is always cooked to perfection and the fries are always served fresh.  I don't have a bad thing to say about this Red Robin Location besides Keep up the good work!
Burgers were good, Staff was great,  Floors were sticky both tile and carpet and really needs to be cleaned

The Ramen Noodle burger was the bomb!  What a great concept.  Sat at the bar since it's usually better attentive service without all the kids.  Waitress started out great and appeared to have become tired and had ringer her attention for refills of our drinks. Besides the waitress needing a nap I guess, great food and atmosphere.

Service was strange but food was really good. Seated almost immediately upon entering the restaurant, a table in the back. Our server came to introduce himself, speaking very fast. It was hard to catch a lot of what he said- the specials, etc. But whatever, we knew what we wanted. I ordered the bacon cheese burger with sweet and spicy ketchup to dip my fries. Our server disappeared for ages and the food was delivered by kitchen staff. We had no silverware and had to chase down our server to ask for some help. The food was excellent, burger cooked perfectly. I always wish the first batch of fries was larger- I swear there were only 7 or 8 total fries on the plate when my food was served. No biggie, they are bottomless so I asked for a 2nd round a bit into my meal. RR now has special dipping sauces for their fries- a few that are free and a few premium ones that cost like $0.50 or something. I really like the sweet & spicy ketchup and campfire sauce, both free. The campfire sauce sort of tastes like BBQ and ranch mixed together- creamy and pretty good. But the sweet & spicy ketchup is so good. Give it a try. Being a chain, I guess I assume that most people have at least heard of Red Robin, and probably have already tried it. So no reason to pitch the menu or the scene. The menu is loaded with burger options, with some other alternative dishes for non-burger lovers. There's chicken tenders, and some chicken sandwiches. Also options for vegetarians plus they have turkey burgers if that's your thing. There's a decent kids menu with appropriate portions for smaller stomachs. Freckles Lemonade is really good but, be warned, it's so full of sugar! Food was five stars but taking one star away for the mediocre service (not bad, we still tipped well)....
The burger was ok, but not worth the price (charm burger).  The onion rings were good though.

Went in last night and just wanted to say how much I enjoyed the gluten free burger. The restaurant was clean,  service was good,  burgers were great.  2 things you could work on: the timing of the endless fries, everything I've gotten my second order has  been brought out after I've finished everything else,  which brings the second thing you could improve on, cook times! Otherwise it was a good experience! I will go back, have been 3 times already,  will recommend!!

Ate here Sunday after church for the first time in many years.  The menu is a little "busy", but the options are great, and they allow substitutions.  They have an awesome kids menu for a great price.  The food was great!

The burger was surprisingly decent but the side Cole slaw was drenched in mayo and was not very appetizing.  The restaurant felt dirty including the silverware.  Our service wasn't the best or the worst but she did the job. We probably won't be coming back because there's much better food in Texas elsewhere.

Our waitress was very sweet. Food was good....I got Smoke & Pepper Burger. Food was very good. My only negative comment would be that I drank water, only ordered a burger and my bill.was.over $15. Prices were on the menu, so this was not a shock....
Not as good as I remembered in Tulsa. Still good though. They did give me my hamburger and sweet potatoe fries for free for my birthday. That was really nice.

The drinks, the drinks here at Red Robin are the BEST drinks EVER! I had the freckled lemonade and raspberry cream soda...they were BOTTOMLESS Y'ALL!!!! I ordered the Wild Pacific Crab Cake Burger (limited edition) OMG SpongeBob himself would approve of this burger! Again, I'm not a fries type of chick, but it helps when you have some fry seasoning to sprinkle on those bad boys. I love Red Robin! Whether in FL or TX I never leave Red Robin hungry or disappointed!

This used to be a fantastic place with great service, good food and reasonable (albeit pretty pricey for a burger joint) prices making it an excellent value. Then the franchisee sold it to back to RR corporate and wham. Prices went up, serving sizes went down and employee attitude went south. It's a shame because it used to be very busy but not anymore. No more happy hours, no more specials no more fun. Good going RR Corp, you just lost 2 regular customers who frequented at least 2 times per week and tipped your staff extremely well because they exuded the spirit of hospitality which doesn't equate to sheer corporate greed. And from the looks of it we're not the only ones you've lost.

My family and I go here often. For a chain restaurant, they have really great burgers. Unless there is a big group, the wait staff is friendly and attentive. We like that they actually cook the burgers according to your specifications and not just on a conveyor. My son and I like rare to med rare, and my husband likes med. to well. They are always done perfectly. It's also a great deal to have bottomless fries with a teenage boy. :)
Even though our tables food came out cold, Brittney, the server was wonderful. Her customer service was excellent and accommodated our table to make things right! I'd definitely come back!

We walked in on a Friday around 3pm for a late lunch. We stood at the entrance for about 10 minutes- the place was a deserted land. After 10 more minutes the bartender came around the corner and greeted us frantically. The poor guy looked like he desperately needed a break. He explained that they were short staffed and would be helping us today. One guy was the hostess, waiter, and bartender. Absolutely ridiculous. I was hesitant to ask for anything because I knew he was already running around. It's not a very nice experience when you feel bad asking for a refill on bottomless fries... I will give 1 star to the food because it was a delicious, juicy burger. The other star goes to the awesome bartender for working his a** off.

Red Robin has been around forever, and it's a chain right? I don't know what they've done to keep up with gourmet burger joints and also make it seem like a fun place to hang out that doesn't have the massive chain feel.  I love Red Robin and always have, but lately they've been coming out with some awesome burger and drink concoctions that make me forget this is a corporate chain you can eat anywhere you go. The DGB and Smoke and Pepper burger are some of the latest they've come out with that have really blown my tastebuds away. Each burger can be replaced with a turkey or veggie patty for whatever you're feeling that day. Bottomless fries with the steak fry seasoning on the table is always a must.  Really nice bartenders here. I actually really like this particular location's bar and service. It's an old school Red Robin that hasn't been updated yet and I secretly hope they keep it that way. The bar is made of a rich wood that reminds me of Cheers and everyone is so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. I sometimes even order off the menu things they used to have and they still let me have them.  This place also has an old school arcade in it, so the kids will be happy and your wallet will be empty.

The short: Very poor service, mediocre food for price. If you really want Red Robin, go to another location. Service: Slow to take order, refill drinks, food not delivered all together, wrong food brought out for one person, difficulty with using rewards system. Food: good variety and bottomless fries, but there are better options in the area for similar price Atmosphere: Decent, plenty of families. Price: For most meals, $10-15, plus drinks and other add-ons Restrooms: not visited Cleanliness: Off smell. Carpeted floor retains stains and stickiness of past diners, but tables and seats were clean.
The food was awesome and the service was good. Also the waiters are really helpful.  Would recommend anyone to come here.

Oh. My. Gosh ...  Overpriced average to below average burger. Outdated decor, dirty carpet and tables. Surely someone from corporate has never visited this place. There are dozens of other higher quality burger places within a few miles. My advice, run away as fast as you can. Our waiter was very nice and attentive. But it's still a dump and I can't believe they pass an inspection to serve food in this place.

This place is just a great place to eat.  I've lived in the area for seven years and I eat here probably once a month.  I've never had bad service.  I've never had a to-go order wrong.  I've never had a bad customer service experience.  Some times you just gotta keep it simple.  What's simpler than a burger and beer?

Tried (really tried!!) to eat here tonight but finally just walked out in frustration. Parking lot was virtually empty and it was 9:00pm on a Saturday night . . . should be able to drop by for a late dinner, right?  Two young women working the hostess table  at the front told us it would be a 10-15 minute wait for a party of two. (Aren't those empty tables behind you??) We waited the 10-15 minutes on the couches up front and then they seated a party of two (not us!) that had just walked in the door. The hostesses continued to leave the front area OVER AND OVER AGAIN to look for wait staff or to see if tables were available. Isn't the point of technology to give you information on the screen in front of you so you don't need to run through the restaurant looking for employees?? We finally left in disgust and headed to Jason's Deli down the street. No one even noticed that we left. Awful customer service. Awful.

We enjoy going to Red Robin. The good is good, the staff is great and are helpful. The stays the same from visit to visit.  The whiskey river chicken sandwich is super.  Would recommend it for families also.

Had lunch there over the weekend. Arriving there the hostess seemed disorganized. Burgers and Wisconsin cheddar bites were very good. The servers suggestion on drinks was excellent. Only showed the Texas Ranger game on one tv. Will definitely visit again.

This place really deserves 4 stars.  The staff is friendly and pretty attentive. This place gives you great rewards if you are in their loyalty program.  The food ranges from decent to delicious. I had the regular sized cookies and cream milkshake. I wish I had ordered the large for $1 more. Decent milkshake but nothing spectacular. I ordered the boneless wings with chips. The chips are horrible. The buffalo wings are ok but not that amazing. I really like the fries with campfire sauce and the Buzz mac-n-cheese double tavern burger. The burger is amazing. I really liked the spiciness of the mac-n-cheese.

This is easily the worst Red Robin I've been to.  We walked in at about 5:20pm.  The restaurant seemed empty.  The hostess walked towards the front where we were standing.  She didn't make eye contact and didn't say anything.  A few minutes later, she seemed a bit irritated "I just got here".  We thought 'o-kay'.  Someone else came and seated us in the dining room.  There were one other couple dining at this time.  We ordered our burgers.  The waitress brought them and asked if there were anything else.  She never ever checked back.  The burgers were definitely not the best.  The fries were awful.  They were not hot.  They were not light and airy like the other Red Robins' fries.  Very disappointing dining experience at the Grapevine TX Red Robin.

Not very good. Pasta was cold, and broccoli was definitely NOT fresh. Also very pricey, I went with a group of 7 split the bill by 2 and 5. The two of us cost 22 and the other 5 cost 88! Bottomless food is just gross. Not good wouldn't recommend.

We ate dinner here and ordered a gluten free burger. It was alright, server was really blah, like he didn't want to do his job, same w the girl when we arrived, nobody even said hello and said "just two of you?" Won't be back.

Went there this afternoon and there was quite a lot of people waiting at the hostess stand and there were many empty tables. We waited for a while for a hostess till I went to find one and asked if we could get a hostess. She was chatting with a table and said I'll be there in a minute. Then she told everyone there was a 10 minute wait. Again, there were plenty of empty tables. I saw people sitting around looking around with no drinks like they were waiting for la waiter. We left.

So, my review isn't really based on food. I ordered a carry out and upon arriving I saw several other cars sitting in the car side area so I decided to walk in and save the time. I walked in to the bar and stood for about 5 minutes waiting for someone to come. The bartender walked up and asked if I was one of the delivery services and I advised no I am just a regular carry out. I handed her a printed out copy of a e-gift card and she walked away. I waited patiently and after about 10 minutes the manager came back and advised the balance on the card. I added a tip and signed. I got home and found that the burger I ordered which was supposed to be a double patty was only a single patty and I selected the extra fries box but there was just a few scattered in the container. It was all pretty good it just wasn't the best experience.

Great service from James the waiter. We got onion rings, and I got the chicken BBQ sandwich, a large beer and a cocktail. Total price was 15.70. Burger was free since it was my bday. Great meal! Haven't been to Red Robin in 3 years but will definitely go back.

My husband and I decided to go here for lunch with our toddler. Red Robin has always been one of our favorite burger places, but this location is nasty. We got there at about 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon and there were three cars in the parking lot. Bone Daddy's across the street had about a 75% full parking lot. This should have been our first clue. We walked in and the restaurant smelled off. It should smell like burgers and fries, but it had more of a sweaty, dirty smell. We were seated and ordered some drinks. After that, I leaned my arms on the table and it was very sticky. I told my husband, he asked for a baby wipe to wipe off the table. He laid it flat on the table and tried to wipe, but it wouldn't move. He had to peel it off the table. He started scrubbing and very quickly the wipe started turning black from all the dirt and residue on the table. I gagged a little, it was really gross. We called the manager over and he didn't seem to care at all. Just said "Oh, well, we're looking into getting new table tops." New table tops doesn't help the fact that they don't appear to have been cleaned in a very long time. If the table tops are that nasty, we didn't want to think about what the kitchen was like. We got up and left. So revolting.

I don't know what's going on with this Red Robin's, I've had good experiences at their other locations. It started off with a pick up order, usually I would go out and get it myself but this time my leg was swollen and painful to walk so I try to stay off it if possible. I had a decent order about $80.00 and called the number for their curb side service to let them know I was here. A lady answered the phone and said they would be right out, I understand if they're busy,  I can wait. But after 20 minutes of no delivery I had to go in which defeated my purpose of not wanting to walk. I went to the pick up counter and again had to wait another 10 minutes while they arranged my food to pick up. And to top it off they weren't busy at all but might have been understaffed. Unpacked it at home and they forgot some things with the order, hardly any fries and very cold food. An unpleasant experience to say the least. So I give them another shot because any business can have a bad day and no one's perfect. Ordered online and went inside to pickup the food, wasn't ready again and waited. Mind you this was a small order of a few items and again place isn't busy....now I know why. Arrived home and noticed the skimpy portion they served me, not up to standards like the other Red Robin's. Needless to say I won't be going back again, employees seem unmotivated and that lies on the manager to train his or her staff.

Red Robin has always been a fave burger spot for both my husband and I and this location did not disappoint! He enjoys the A1 Peppercorn... My favorite is the Banzai with grilled pineapple... And we both have zero problems indulging in their endless garlic Parmesan fries! Their strawberry Freckled Lemonade is always delicious and refreshing as well! Will be back!

I quit going here because they ignore you at the front door. I came back. Tonight there wasn't any staff to ignore us when walking in.. as usual. A manager finally stumbled out. I asked him if they were open. He mumbled 'yes' and looked off in the distance, then eventually wandered away. Subsequently a hostess didn't even answer and walked around in front of us. Winning! The waitress was good, efficient. The burger was tiny and felt light, for $7. Whataburger would have been better and cheaper.

Just got a to-go order from this location and we are beyond disappointed. 90% of the reason we was for the fries. Ordered a burger with bottomless and an extra side to go with it. Normally that's more than enough for both of us. It looked like they honestly didn't make enough and just took fries from my burger to put in the other box. There was a grand total of 15 between the two orders. Both my boyfriend and I have worked in the service industry quite a lot and this is just unacceptable. His wings had almost no sauce to top it off. Only reason I gave two stars was they put the burger together okay. Update: Moved the review down to one star because I couldn't chew through half of the burger. It was hard but for some reason liquid (from lettuce/tomatos???) kept dripping everywhere. I usually love Red Robin but this meal just made me feel sick to my stomach.

Something about the place and the food does not feel wholesome nor comforting. I first discovered Red Robin in Los Angeles and I would up to 3 times per week. The fries the soups the awesome burgers all feel right but the vibe or service has somehow gotten cold....

This has been my favorite restaurant chain for 25 years. We went there for all our birthdays, when family was in town, basically always our "go to" every time we ate out. This location was declined so much I will no longer take my family. The hostesses looked annoyed when you walk in, servers look disheveled and are rude, and it gets filthier each time I go. This last visit was final straw. After using dirty restroom where my feet stuck to floor (it wasn't from recent mopping I assure you) I sat down to a roach over 2 inches long crawling on wall by my head. Nope nope nope.  When I left a review I recieved NO follow up or apology, zilch.  I AM a GM....I know how to satisfy guests...and you failed miserably on all points.

It's good food, but Grapevine location doesn't seat anyone in 'bar' dining area under 21. Texas law allows it, but apparently corporate doesn't. Extended our wait for an additional 20 minutes even though the seating was wide open in the other 'bar' area. Doubt we will return. It's not like you can't get a drink.ay the regular dining tables, so not sure what it accomplishes. Other restaurants allow it.

Want a crappy fast food burger at sit down restaurant prices? They got you. Don't worry, they'll fill your fat tummy up with unlimited drinks and fries. I guess they think gourmet means picking a bunch of random ingredients to put on your .056 lb bland burger.

Nov 24th visit.  7 people in the group.  Service was very slow.  Drinks left unfilled and I gave up asking.  I noticed other tables had drinks and fries and food served quickly.  I going to assume we got the new guy. Ordered the Marco Polo and it was way over cooked.  Will not order that again. Spent about 1:15 total for a work lunch.   Will certainly be back because Red Robin makes a great burger.  But will be more particular about who waits on us.

Food is consistent, service is lacking I've been here a couple of times some ok experience but alot of bad experiences. Recently I've had a run in with servers where either don't know the menu or lack the effort to care.

Extremely long wait. Rude, defensive hostess. Argumentative and unprofessional. If you don't hire enough staff for a holiday weekend then shame on you. Not doing your homework on gluten-free menu items is inexcusable. Non-gluten free ranch dressing?  Friendly waitstaff and mgr. but overall very disappointed.
I order a side salad for my boss  it cost 4.00 dollars and it was not full or worth 4.00 dollars .

I went back remembering the BLTA being awesome at a different location. It was about 11:30 am or so on Thursday, Jan 4th. The hostess Jessica was nice and seated us immediately. The waitress Janice was right behind her as was not only attentive and polite but also engaged in intelligent conversation. She never took our empty plate but didn't hold it against her not knowing the policy of never-ending french fries.  However, the BLTA was so dry and had way more turkey than bacon, it was more like a Club than a BLT - and on a FAKE STALE 'croissant'. The place was dirty or at least the wall next to us had ketchup splattered on it. The manager did come and ask if everything was ok but I couldn't put my finger on what was wrong with the BLTA until after so said 'all fine'. I would have given more stars for the effort but two stars because not only was the sandwich so bad the price was crazy at over $11! For that much I expect much better.
Went there last night and sat in bar area. The beeping noise is very annoying! I could not enjoy my dinner!
